website_summaries.verdict: An exceptional smoker from a company with a reputation for quality. The best money can buy.
pros: Unlike most smokers, this package includes a protective cover
Easy to adjust temp with dampers
Easy to add more charcoal or wood while cooking
cons: Doesn't have some of the bells and whistles that other high-end smokers have

customer_reviews.title: 14 is pretty small.  I switched to the 18 once I saw it.
customer_reviews.text: I’d go with the 18” at a minimum. I relied on a couple reviews that said 18” was more than they needed. This unit is pretty darn small. If you only do port butts, fine, but no way you can do a full pork belly or spatchcock turkey or big rib rack on the 14. I did not even take this unit out of box. I could tell the grates were too small for pretty much anything I want to cook. I’m sure it works great but it’s pretty limited due to the size. Draw a 14” circle on a piece of paper and if you first reaction is “that’s too small”, like me, get the 18 or 22.
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: You ain’t gonna believe this!!
customer_reviews.text: The thermometer that came with my 14.5 shows the temp at the grill grate inside, I swear. I had my oven thermometer sitting on the grill grate. I had my ThermPro at the grill height. And could not believe my eyes that when all my thermometers read 225 degrees at the top grill grate, the thermometer on the lid read 225. So , I’m thinking, without researching it, that Weber calibrated them that way. I could be wrong and I just got lucky. I have no idea. Having a riot trying to wire this smokin thing. Solid unit. So far, I’m all in.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Van Vleck

customer_reviews.title: Great smoker, but replace the door.
customer_reviews.text: I've been using the 22.5" WSM for the last 10 years, and I love it. My only gripe is the flimsy door and door latch. The door never sealed right, and the latch eventually broke. I highly recommend replacing the crappy door, with the Cajun Bandit Stainless Steel Smoker Door With Latch. The Cajun Bandit door is thick, seals perfectly, and the locking mechanism is super sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: D. Stamatis

customer_reviews.title: great smoker
customer_reviews.text: simple to assemble. great directions on best way to smoke. Love not using lighter fluid or starter charcoal. Only need to add charcoal after 4 hours so no spending all day babysitting. 14 inch size is perfect for two people and have left overs - especially with double layer grill. Have cooked briskets, chicken and sausage. All perfect. Website is great for instructions and ideas
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: No thermometer
customer_reviews.text: I haven’t been able to use it yet because all of the parts weren’t in the box. I spent $40 on a brisket and when I finished putting the smoker together there was no thermometer or bezel for the thermometer. This was going to be my first attempt at a brisket. I know accidents happen but making sure all the parts are in the box should be easy enough. Weber is sending me a new one and should arrive in 7-10 days.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 14" WSM
customer_reviews.text: I bought the 14" WSM. I heard good reviews from several bbq experts and it seems to be quite the little vessel for my purpose. I'm usually cooking for 2 so it's all I need. Easy to assemble although the manual only gives you an exploded view. A quick google search and you'll find 20 videos on WSM assembly. It's big enough for a smaller turkey or a full rack of ribs. My only real gripe is the door on the side is a turn style open/close that sometimes doesn't catch the lip to shut properly. I really like the cover it comes with, it has elastic straps to keep it snug. Overall good bang for your buck.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I've used it probably a dozen or more times and it continues to get better and better
customer_reviews.text: Tough to think of things wrong with this thing. I've used it probably a dozen or more times and it continues to get better and better. Temps were hard to keep down when it was new, but that was to be expected. As it has continued to seal up through use, I have left it for 2 hours at times and come back to find it had only nudged in temperature 1-2°. Was considering an electric smoker but nothing replaces a charcoal smoker in my opinion. I know I'll have this for years and years and will continue to use it with pleasure.
customer_reviews.author: Shelly

customer_reviews.title: Works well, not bulky, and decently priced
customer_reviews.text: I'm glad I didn't get a larger size. We can smoke two racks of ribs and a whole chicken at the same time. Anything larger would have been well beyond what we need. It works well and is simple to use. I would say the only difficulty with it is that the racks are stacked vertically on top of each other, and it's a bit tricky to get the lower rack out when while using hot pads/bulky gloves to avoid burning your hands. The trade off is that the unit doesn't take up a lot of space, and it's also a decent price.
customer_reviews.author: Gregorus S. Davis

customer_reviews.title: Look no further
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome. One of my better purchases through Amazon. If you're starting out in smoking, look no further. This is a high quality cooker that retains heat well, has plenty of space to cook two things at once and the thermometer works well and is accurate. Very easy to add wood chips or charcoal. I've had mine for a while now and it's still going strong. It's an excellent value.
customer_reviews.author: Gunner McParson

customer_reviews.title: great smoker! Bought to smoke my first Turkey
customer_reviews.text: great smoker! Bought to smoke my first Turkey! Smoked two 22 pound birds and they turned out great! About 4.5 hours at 325 and water pan was empty with foil lined in it.
customer_reviews.author: JASWINDER SANDHU

customer_reviews.title: perfect size - great quality - good price
customer_reviews.text: Great smoker (14") for two, easy to use, very forgiving, great for first timer or pro - it just works - very well thought out with the side access door, the two levels of grills, good quality materials (not cheap) - comes with a cover so don't order one. Get the dual temp digital thermometer to go with it, can't really do without that since the dome dial thermometer is not that accurate compared to the digital (dual) one measures at the grill where the meat is and the other probe measures meat temp. I'm just having a great time with this thing, couldn't be happier. My first season of smoking, I'm hooked.
customer_reviews.author: Mike D

customer_reviews.title: Bad quality control, door has a huge gap
customer_reviews.text: Who is in charge of quality control at Weber where they let a door to the smoker so bent that there's no way smoke isn't pouring out. Bought this one because of made in USA was hoping for quality like my other Weber grills
customer_reviews.author: Adam Inferrera

customer_reviews.title: It's no Lion in Winter
customer_reviews.text: Bought this a couple of years ago and have generally been pleased with it. The most significant drawback, however, is that it does not perform particularly well in the winter. We live near Syracuse, NY where it can get pretty cold in winter. The Weber struggles to hold heat and you wind up going through a LOT of charcoal. Even with that, I often have to finish a pork butt off in the oven. Once outdoor temp gets to 45 or better, then no problem. The 18" grill will easily handle good sized pork butts, turkeys and about 4 racks of ribs.
customer_reviews.author: Barb Mc

customer_reviews.title: Great but too small
customer_reviews.text: This review is actually based on the 18.5 inch unit. When I received the 14" unit I realized immediately that it was not big enough to be practical for what I would consider general smoking applications. I sent it back unopened and ordered the 18". It's perfect for me. The 18" unit is well made and easy to use and assemble. It holds temp very well once you get over the tendency to "chase the needle". I have used it several times and love it. Another big plus for me was that it comes with a quality cover.
customer_reviews.author: mike lewis

customer_reviews.title: Most Bang for Your Buck!
customer_reviews.text: After much research and contemplation, I finally pulled the trigger and ordered the 18.5" WSM. I have to say, that was the best decision I have made on any purchase this year! After following Harry Soo's seasoning recommendations the last couple of days, I put my WSM to the test today with 3 racks of St Louis style ribs. Temp control was beyond belief, and fuel consumption extremely modest (I used about 1/3 of a 15 lb bag of Kingsford Applewood and 3 chunks of crabapple from a tree in my backyard). 6 hours in the WSM and I had prize winners at my family gathering tonight! If you are even casually considering a WSM, I HIGHLY reccomend this product!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Believe the hype...because it's true
customer_reviews.text: Just smoked my first brisket and it was amazing!!!!!!!!!! After an EXTENSIVE amount of research, I went with the Weber as all the reviews were positive and I see why. This is a nice little smoker that is user friendly. We ate the brisket for lunch and my only complaint is that there's none left for leftovers. Definitely worth the investment. I got a nice smoke ring on my first effort, and I ate it as a badge of honor. Weber, thanks for making a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Joey R.

customer_reviews.title: Great smoker and holds heat well
customer_reviews.text: I love this smoker. I've had a cheap off-brand one before and can really appreciate this one. The temp control takes a little getting used to, but it holds that temp very well. I always feel the water pan with hot water and all the meat comes out juicy. I've done a 16 hour brisket, 6 hours for racks of ribs, turkeys and chickens on this, with other smaller pieces of chicken and haven't been disappointed yet. I would highly recommend getting a temperature probe that will help getting the exact ending temp just right. This is a good quality product and built to last.
customer_reviews.author: Ahmad

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised, interactive
customer_reviews.text: This is my first and only smoker, and I've been successful on 3 or 4 attempts... and the failure was my lack of experience. For simplicity and reliability, this can't be beat... start charcoal, place pan of water, put on meat, watch for temperature to be about 225'F... Maintain. It is not the easiest to add fuel to, or the water, but I made a trough to guide the water into the pan, and we use the natural wood charcoal not briquettes (no additives or binders thanks....) The pan of wood charcoal lasts about 3 hours, and the pan of water about 4 to 5 hours. Great flavor, simple to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Clarke (Owner and User)

customer_reviews.title: "Holy Smokes Batman" This is incredible!
customer_reviews.text: "Holy Smokes Batman" This is incredible! Never thought I'd be getting this kind of smoked meat at home Get the "Meathead - Science to Smoking" book with it - it's a must read
customer_reviews.author: Ronald J. Martinkus

customer_reviews.title: I love my WSM
customer_reviews.text: I love my WSM!!!! This is the 1st smoker I have ever owned and I am amazed how easy it use. I have smoked 3 texas style briskets, a couple chickens, some picnic style pork butts, and made amazing burnt ends on this smoker. Every single time my meat has cooked perfectly, been tender and juicy and wowed my guests. I would't buy any other smoker than this for you first timers like myself. Totally recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jessie James

customer_reviews.title: Super upset
customer_reviews.text: After reading about this grill for so long I was excited to order it. When it arrived the main cylinder was so badly damaged that it wouldnt seat properly. Been attempting to get a hold of people but haven't heard a response yet.
customer_reviews.author: Dell

customer_reviews.title: Weber 18” smoker is overrated IMO
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed. 7 hours into my first smoke with this unit, and having held the temp contestant at 220, the 8 lb brisket I’m working with plateaued at 158F about 2 hours ago. I know it’s not supposed to be 195 by now, and I don’t want it to. It plateaued - even with more charcoal and hour ago. Praying for a miracle over the next 3-4 hours...
customer_reviews.author: David Ross

customer_reviews.title: Did not come with all the nuts and bolts
customer_reviews.text: The grill came somewhat pre-assemble but did not come with the rest of the assembly parts required. The box was missing the handle assembly screw and three internal nuts and bolts for the rack(s) configuration. This was a poorly Q/C end product. I have purchased and own several Weber products. This experience was the absolutely the worst experience in twenty years.
customer_reviews.author: MR

customer_reviews.title: Weber smokers.. Try them once, and you will never buy another smoker!!
customer_reviews.text: My old Weber smoker finally died, so I bought a new one. It meets my expectations in every way, with the exception of a minor omission; it has no handles, on the sides, to move it. At times, one has to move an object for varying reasons, but this smoker has no outside handles, on the sides, to do so. The only way to move it is: 1. If apart, and cool, it moves piece-by-piece (just three). 2. If hot, by using "Ov-Gloves" after top is removed, and grasping both inside and outside of top section. As far as smoking food, best there is for all types of meat. None better for a charcoal smoker.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: WSM is amazing and great!
customer_reviews.text: So this package is definitely a two man carry. The box was delivered and I had to open it up at my door and bring the parts to the garage piece by piece. Its not that the smoker is crazy heavy but the box is huge. Assembly is straight forward but can get tricky putting the heat guard on and the legs at the same time. Everything else is very straight forward. However, when I finally assembled the Weber Smokey Mountain (WSM) it was a little off. Found out the legs were not evenly bent. I contacted Weber and within an overnight (Two days) they had supplied me with three brand new legs which solved the problem.
customer_reviews.author: Ringer127

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I don’t think this product needs a review. It’s a Webber!!! I love it!!! Hold the temperature, fits 4 to 5 large rack of ribs at the time, very compact in size and super easy to clean. I mean, this is an amazing mid size smoker. Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: Dima Oksenkrug

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected of Weber
customer_reviews.text: I was disappointed in this smoker. As an owner of a Weber Grill for over 20 years, I guess I expected the smoker to be of the same quality as their grills. It is too small and is not easy to add charcoal to. It does not maintain temperature required to smoke food for a long period (minimum 5 hours). I would not recommend this to anyone that is a serious smoker. It may be appropriate for the novice smoker.
customer_reviews.author: book buyer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Purchase!
customer_reviews.text: I am a first time barbecuer when I got this for my birthday. Looked at the Smokey Mountain versus kamado grills and offset cookers. The large Smokey Mountain was half the price of Kamado Grills and quality offsets. I have made pulled pork butt, st. louis cut ribs, and hald chickens so far, and all have turned out fantastic. Very little learning curve, and cookbook/magazine recipes are easilly adaptable to this cooker. Get the large if you intend to do multiple racks of ribs or whole brisket. Great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel J Tierney

customer_reviews.title: Great Smoker, probably one of the best.
customer_reviews.text: Love my Smokey Mountain Smoker. Never have a smoke anything. Yet, within a week I have smoked a brisket, slab of baby back ribs, a whole chicken, and a pork butt. All turned out tasty, tender, and delicious. I pretty much was scared to death, thinking this was going to be a huge cost, and ultimate disaster. Not at all. I am totally happy with this purchase, and recommend this to anyone that wants delicious meat. I love my Smokey Mountain Smoker. You will not be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Joan M Laird

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied
customer_reviews.text: This wS a gift for my grandson, so I haven’t used it myself. However, he loves it! And, I’ve been fortunate to enjoy the wonderful I’ll dishes he has prepared using it. I am extremely pleased I purchased it. How did I know this was the smoker I wanted to purchase as a gift? Because I asked him what he wanted. He had done the research and said this was the best one.😊
customer_reviews.author: Walker

customer_reviews.title: Best smoker in the price range
customer_reviews.text: I've had my Smokey Mountain Bullet for 6 years. I have cooked up some awesome tasting meat on this cooker. I like the portability. I just load the 3 sections into the bed of my truck. I've now been cooking for about every holiday and family room that comes along and see myself doing it for the foreseeable future. Cooking on this smoker is just plain fun. I highly recommend a Weber Smokey Mountain cooker.
customer_reviews.author: TR

customer_reviews.title: A great smoker for two
customer_reviews.text: I have had the 18” & 22” WSM and the 14” is a perfectly scaled down version of the larger model. It is as easy to adjust and holds temps just like the big boys. This is a great smoker for the two of us and I believe it would work really well for a family of four. If you are on the fence about the size don’t be worried and pull the trigger. This is a well built awesome little smoker
customer_reviews.author: George Weber

customer_reviews.title: Great smoker
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. I can be a pain for heat management, but the food that comes off is great. The built in thermometer goes out pretty quick, but most do. I know I could probably take it apart and clean it and it'll work, but we all use additional thermometers and meat probes so what's the point. I only wish it was easier to work with things on the lower rack when using both. Planning well can usually alleviate that, but sometimes you just need to get to the lower one without disturbing the top one.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Great smoker!
customer_reviews.text: This smoker is excellent. I've been wanting to buy it for several years but held off. Now that i bought one im so glad that i finally did. It holds a steady temp for a long time, and has pleanty of room for a lot of meat. If you are considering it i recommend the 22 inch you definitely won't be dissapointed.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Great smoker
customer_reviews.text: A really nice smoker. Easy to use and hold temperature. Lots of good support groups on FB with ideas, recipes, etc. A 15lb bag of charcoal will last and entire brisket cook (12-15 hrs). Water pan helps regulate temps and add moisture or remove it if it's not your thing. A great smoker if you don't have access to lots of wood like what's needed in an offset smokers. Keep in mind that people compete using this smokers and win competitions. If you looking a set it and forgot it smoker and want real bbq favor ( i.e. not electric or pellet) this is the great solution.
customer_reviews.author: Pletjreed

customer_reviews.title: Great little smoker
customer_reviews.text: Husband wanted to start smoking meat and I kept finding this unit mentioned as a top contender. I went back and forth with pellet vs charcoal, but he is very happy I went this route. So far he loves it. In fact the only down side is that he has cooked so much stuff that my kitchen has a lingering smell of meat. He will be taking the advice often expressed in reviews to get an aftermarket door to make the seal a little tighter, but it’s great right out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: Amy A

customer_reviews.title: Good but way overpriced
customer_reviews.text: Works good but these things are way overpriced. $220 for basically a 14" charcoal grill with a little extra metal is insane. You can buy a really nice & bigger gas grill for that much. You can only fit 2 racks of ribs on the 14" barely. Would recommend getting a 'ThermoPro TP03 Digital Thermometer' to stick in the side probe port since it's more accurate than the dome thermometer.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product, great service.
customer_reviews.text: The middle ring section of the smoker arrived damaged, two deep dents on the outside that cracked the outer glaze. I called Weber and they where outstanding at making sure the issue was resolved, best customer service I have ever dealt with. As for the smoker, so far it has performed as expected and has been another great product from Weber. I went with the 22 and I’m glad that I did, the extra real estate is nice,I recently smoked 4 rack’s of baby backs side by side with ease and there was no cutting, bending, or use of rib racks. Spend the extra 100 bucks It’s worth it.
customer_reviews.author: jason

customer_reviews.title: Quality product
customer_reviews.text: The instructions for assembly are in pictures. The two types of washers are challenging to tell apart from just pictures. I had to take it apart and put it back correctly. As for the quality,it is exactly what I expected from Webber, perfect. It retains heat, cooks evenly and is simple to use. Clean up was easy. The racks held two large chickens and 8 large bundles of sausage without being crowded. I live in Costa Rica where finding smoked meat is a challenge so this is an essential part of my food preparation here. I would definitely buy this smoker again.
customer_reviews.author: Eddie Turner

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: Replaced one that was stolen. Webber builds a good product. Like this smoker for its size. Getting to the lower rack is a bit difficult but not a huge problem. This medium size works for us. Easily smoke 2 large racks of ribs up top and a 5 lb brisket below. Added an electronic controlled fan to regulate temperature which works really well on the Webber
customer_reviews.author: Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: I love my WSM, seasoned it as Harry Soo said to, Thanks Harry :D. I had always used a smoker with the side firebox and had a hell of a time controlling the smoker temp and running out of coal/wood within a couple of hours, first time using it temp stayed right where i wanted it and lasted over 10 hours on just the initial charcoal i put in there. I recommend to get the hinge for the lid mod as finding a place to put the hot lid down was not so pleasant.
customer_reviews.author: Chaodyn

customer_reviews.title: Great smoker....make sure parts aren't missing.
customer_reviews.text: I've owned Webber Kettles before but this is the 1st smoker I've purchased. So far the only problem I've had is the fact that 3 of the silver washers were missing. I have a well stocked garage so it was not a huge problem for me, more of a disappointment. Webber obviously needs better quality control in their packaging department. Baby back ribs broke in my smoker, they were very good. Going to be smoking salmon later today. Had a bit of an issue controlling the temperature but I'll improve on that with a little more practice.
customer_reviews.author: laura guerrero

customer_reviews.title: Great lil Smokie
customer_reviews.text: So far so good! I got the 18 based on reviews from others that the smaller wasn’t quite big enough. So far, I love it. It’s a little tricky getting it to temp and maintaining temp (mine is too hot for too long), but I’ll figure it out. I’ve tried out pork belly, ribs, and tri tip. All have been good, but tri tip was the absolute best. If you know what you’re doing and will be smoking a lot, this will be good. Alternatively, you can also get a small charcoal grill and use it in a similar fashion if you’re looking for something smaller and more affordable.
customer_reviews.author: CristyC

customer_reviews.title: Smoker
customer_reviews.text: This I have to say is one great smoker I wasted money on others big mistake this thing does everything I added the digi que fan system and this was great smoke a brisket went to bed got up the next morning still had coals but the system stopped just like it was supposed to when the brisket hit the desired temperatures
customer_reviews.author: John J. Edger Jr.

customer_reviews.title: 14 inch great for two people
customer_reviews.text: Works great for two people. I've done 185 for salmon and 225 for ribs and brisket with cook times up to 5 hours no need to add additional fuel and still had some left over (fill charcoal chamber then light a few charcoals with a chimney starter throw them on top, leave bottom grates open till you get to desired temp and close the bottom vents). Amazing upgrade over trying to smoke in a charcoal grill. If cooking for more I would recommend getting the bigger version though.
customer_reviews.author: awantura

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Bought this smoker to upgrade ftome my other one. Took it to Michigan Speedway and everything from chicken to orime rib. The durability of the smoker is out of the world. It holds heat and temperature at ease. The water pan is big enough for a 8 hour smoke. The only time i had to add water is when smoking brisket, but that takes 16 hours so thats expected!
customer_reviews.author: marty0461

customer_reviews.title: Just the right size for two people
customer_reviews.text: I had one of these several years ago that was a larger size. It worked great, made excellent barbeque. This one is smaller but just the right size for the wife and I. I use a blower to control the temperature and therefore I don't have to constantly check the dampeners. Works great. In this smaller one it seems like it uses less charcoal. Glad I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bad quality control. Holes for one leg on bowl are drilled wrong.
customer_reviews.text: Received from Amazon today. Found holes for one leg on the bowl drilled wrong. Can't bolt leg on without damaging the bowl. See the included pictures. Even with leg bolted on, the center section won't fit correctly. Will have to return to Amazon. Got in touch with Weber's support. A new lower bowl was sent out. I received it today, one week after I contacted them. The legs bolt up perfectly, and the center section now fits perfectly. Change rating to 5 Stars. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Jetman

customer_reviews.title: Love it, works great
customer_reviews.text: Love it, works great. Only 4 star is due to it being too smal, even for small family servings. Hard to keep the temp high enough due to small internal volume while smoking only 2 racks of pork ribs, and 4 chicken legs. I ended up buying the 18". Now I'm stuck with both.
customer_reviews.author: hammer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Smoker!!
customer_reviews.text: This is AMAZING! I started with the Weber rapidfire chimney starter using 1 sheet of crumpled newspaper and a dozen Kingsford briquetts. After a half hour it was covered with ash and was dumped on the grate in the Smokey - I added about a dozen more briquetts, waited until they were hot, put on my ribs and voila! After about 6 hours they were done to perfection, but the really amazing part is that this smoker maintained an even temperature of 250 degrees for nearly 12 hours! I could not believe it!
customer_reviews.author: breadlady

customer_reviews.title: I love this smoker but there are a couple design flaws
customer_reviews.text: I love this smoker but there are a couple design flaws. First, the door is absolutely horribly designed. It leaks terribly because it's not even close to a perfect fit. It's loose, flimsy and cheap. Second, the dome also leaks a lot of smoke and the dome thermometer is inaccurate. It will read accurately until you get past 275F, then it can have a temperature discrepancy of up to 50F. I compared temps against 2 instant read digital thermometers. Because of these issues, temp swings can be large and coal burning efficiency is extremely low. I will be investing in gaskets and a aftermarket door.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Really Good!
customer_reviews.text: I have used this smoker 4 times and it has been consistent in how tender the meat turns out. I use Kingsford Professional charcoal. This unit is a bit expensive, and huge, but its worth it. I was thinking of getting the 18.5 and ended up getting the 22.5 because I did not want to have any regrets later. So far, I think I made the right choice. I did replace the door, because the original is a bit flimsy, but otherwise, its a very well built product.
customer_reviews.author: Benero E.

customer_reviews.title: Love my bullet!
customer_reviews.text: We purchased our bullet to smoke turkey one Thanksgiving and it's been a tradition since. We use it for many other meals throughout the year and it hasn't failed us yet. Weber makes a quality product and this is no exception. Our smoker has been beaten up quite a bit in a couple blizzards and harsh winters unprotected, but you could never tell. Our only issue is that our cover was blown off in one of the blizzards and no one local has a replacement so we have to wait to get it from Amazon. It would be nice if the cover came with some clips on the end to attach to the legs so it won't happen again.
customer_reviews.author: Kari P.

customer_reviews.title: Omg yes
customer_reviews.text: We got this smoker for my dad for Christmas - a gift we can all benefit from, of course. In just two weeks he’s made the most delicious, melt in your mouth, smokey pork BBQ, brisket, and top round. He loves it so much he just sits outside and watches while it does it magic. Thank you, Weber, for another great product.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding
customer_reviews.text: I am in love with this smoker. There is some assembly when it arrives in a very large box. Probably bout 30 minutes to get it put together for most people. Well built and designed smoker. The door is a bit flimsy but does nothing to detract from the quality of this smoker. This is the product you want to use if you smoke meet. It comes with a cover too. Very nice and highly recommend this to novice and experienced bbq'ers.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald B

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: Holds temp perfectly. I got the 18” and it barely fits a 12 pound brisket. Should of sized up. Hard to move. Build a small frame with casters. Very well built smoker. Very happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: shaun

customer_reviews.title: Great little smoker
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect for our family of 3. Putting together was very easy EXCEPT the little rubber casket around the temperature probe opening. My husband and I both tried for an hour or so, looked on-line and didn't get any better. We challenged our son to do it and do it he did. Only took about 10 minutes. Worked great, had some great stuff to try, look forward to getting great smoked mean dinners from this.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy Skelton

customer_reviews.title: Best Way to Learn the Art of Smoking is on a Weber Smokey Mountain
customer_reviews.text: The best way to learn the Art of Smoking is on a Weber Smokey Mountain. As a newbie I received this a year ago for Father's Day and have learned through trial and error how to smoke some pretty great stuff. If the requests from my neighbors and friends are any indication, this smoker is a hit! It was the perfect smoker for me to "learn" on and now that I have become adept at smoking pork butt, ribs and chicken, I need a bigger Weber!
customer_reviews.author: J. Alexander Greenwood

customer_reviews.title: Great smoker
customer_reviews.text: I use this thing two times a week. Its compact, accurate temp gauge on the top, and easy to use. Honestly getting the smaller one is fine, I can fit a tri tip and rack of ribs in one cook, which is plenty for me and my wife. If you do beer butt chicken you will have to remove the top rack and do it solo tho.
customer_reviews.author: EMHuskey

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE MY 22” WSM!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love my 22” Weber Smokey Mountain. Operation of this smoker is simple and straightforward. There are many online forums and blog groups that have been very helpful and interesting to read. Great ribs, chicken, brisket, potatoes, corn - everything is delicious! You won’t regret this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: MD

customer_reviews.title: With a little practice this smoker does a great job of holding temperature for as many hours as ...
customer_reviews.text: Reading some of the other reviews you'd think you need a PhD to smoke a piece of meat. Don't overthink it. With this smoker you just start some charcoal with a chimney, dump it into a bigger pile of charcoal, throw a few lumps of hardwood on there, put it together, add meat, adjust the vents, then find something else to do for 6-10 hours while it cooks. With a little practice this smoker does a great job of holding temperature for as many hours as you need with minimum intervention. I've done pork, beef and turkey and the results are always great.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Luna

customer_reviews.title: The best!
customer_reviews.text: Another review by EU is the most spot on review, I'm glad I read it and went with the 14"! My husband tells me every time he smokes something that he just loves it so much. Keeps it's heat perfectly and is the perfect size for our family of 4 and would still be perfect when we have any of our siblings with their families over.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Great smoker with warranty
customer_reviews.text: This was my first smoker and we had some great food come of this weber. It is easy to use once it has sealed up. I added a gasket set to the door and lid which helps. The main selling point for me was the capacity on the 22in. The warranty is also nice. Also amazingribs .com is a great website for learning the science behind grilling.
customer_reviews.author: greg

customer_reviews.title: it likes 250-270 a lot better. It does indeed consume more fuel
customer_reviews.text: A must have for the serious BBQ'r this is a upgrade to its little brother the WSM 18". I find that the temp fluctuation on this smoker swing higher than that of the 18". Its harder to keep 220-225 on this model, it likes 250-270 a lot better. It does indeed consume more fuel, however that's a easy trade off for the larger cooking area that it gives you. Mate it with a stoker or Guru and its a win.
customer_reviews.author: J.Sanders

customer_reviews.title: Smoke Your Food
customer_reviews.text: I love my smoker. I have tried grill and smoker and I seem to love the smoker. The food I smoke on the Weber is delicious. I like the two racks, temperature gage, and separate section for charcoal. I recommend carefully reading the instructions for safety and how to use the smoker. I was happy it came with a covering so I can keep it on my open porch.
customer_reviews.author: Rosalind O. King

customer_reviews.title: BUY THIS SMOKER!!!!
customer_reviews.text: AMAZING RESULTS!!!!! My husband smoked two racks of ribs and two chickens first. Then a whole turkey and chicken breast the next day. The food was moist with perfect flavor, just absolutely delicious with very little effort. The reviews were spot on. BUY THIS SMOKER!!!!! Thank me later.
customer_reviews.author: daletyson

customer_reviews.title: Great Smoker!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my husband as a Father's Day gift back in June. He's never had a smoker before and carefully read the instructions when it came. We've had it for a couple months now and absolutely love it. Our friends have an electric smoker and while it is easier to operate, there is just something better about the flavor a charcoal smoker gives you. My husband has enjoyed trying to new recipes and everything he's made has come out tasting fantastic. He's happy with his gift and I couldn't be happier he's enjoying it.
customer_reviews.author: Brodie Mom

customer_reviews.title: Great if you like repairs and dislike smoking
customer_reviews.text: If you enjoy having to fix broken handles and many other poor quality control issues from Weber, this is your smoker. If you enjoy spending time trying to fix items rather than smoking meat, this is your smoker.
customer_reviews.author: M. Erdman

customer_reviews.title: Really Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: I debated on getting this or an electric smoker. I am really glad I got the Weber. You have to be an idiot not to figure out how to use this. It works great and requires very little attention while smoking. I used this for the first time this past Saturday. Smoked a boston butt for 13 hours and never had to add more charcoal. Used the Minion Method for starting the coals. Did not season the smoker as some suggested and it turned out freakin awesome. It held a steady temperature between 225 and 239 degrees with very little to do on my part. Get one...you will be glad you did.
customer_reviews.author: RG

customer_reviews.title: A great smoker, particularly for someone new to smoking
customer_reviews.text: I live in Kansas City, where barbecue rules. Some friends encouraged me to buy a Green Egg or a pellet smoker, but I was turned off by the price tag. After reading reviews and talking to some people that have participated in the American Royal on semi-serious teams, I decided to purchase the Smokey Mountain. I love this smoker. It heats to the desired temperature and stays there with minimal intervention. I have smoked, chicken, pork and ribs so far. I have always been satisfied with the results. Most recently, I smoked 3 racks of baby back ribs on the top rack and three whole chickens on the lower rack. Everything turned out really well.
customer_reviews.author: Michael A.

customer_reviews.title: I am new to smoking food
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of research prior to purchasing Smoky Mountain 14 inch Weber Smoker and what they ALL stated was the truth. BEST powerful smoker for the size. My first item smoke was a 10lb pork shoulder. The shoulder took 10 hours to fully smoke and I needed to refill the coals 1 time due to my error of only using only wood chunks and had to run out and purchase coals to burn with more wood chunks. The temperature stayed consistent through the entire smoking process. Thank Weber !!
customer_reviews.author: Reka

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Great product! My husband has used it to do brisket over 18 hrs and it held its temp fantastically! It’s large enough that we didn’t have to worry about it at all. We’re really excited to break it in for thanksgiving! Update: we pretty much use it for every protein now. Especially salmon. I don’t think we could ever go back to oven only.
customer_reviews.author: Brit

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I was dying to try smoking. Looked at so many choices but I'm a Weber fan so I went with it. I like smoking old school, no electronic gadgets. It's plenty big for our family of 4, I smoked chicken thighs for 6 people for pulled chicken and this was plenty big. Really love this!
customer_reviews.author: RW

customer_reviews.title: Easy to deal with
customer_reviews.text: After years of various smokers and messing around with them constantly, I finally found one that is pretty much a set and forget. Easy to load, easy to use. Constructed well and once the supply vents are set to about the width of a pencil it maintains steady temp with no other fuss.
customer_reviews.author: JB109

customer_reviews.title: Love this WSM Smoker!
customer_reviews.text: For the price, this is a perfect smoker! You can smoke quite a lot of food on this smoker because of the 2 smoking racks. There are tons of mods and upgrades if you want them. It's easy to clean and we love it. It does a great job of smoking meat and is fairly compact. It's extremely well made.
customer_reviews.author: Jayne

customer_reviews.title: WSM... it’s where the meat is...
customer_reviews.text: A word of warning.... like color tv’s you can never get too big. I bought the 18” and after my first cook I wished I had bought the 22”. If you are just cooking a few items the 18” is spectacular, but if you are doing multi racks and several butts you may want to consider the 22”. But no matter what the WSM is the best bang for your buck. You won’t be disappointed...
customer_reviews.author: Beau Williams

customer_reviews.title: Light weight, works well
customer_reviews.text: Nice smoker that works well. I bought it for my husband and he seems very happy with it. It is a little lighter weight than I expected for a Weber, but it works well and my husband likes it, so that is what counts. We have had it for about a year and a half and are very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa N Maxwell

customer_reviews.title: These are good smokers, a good way to get into smoking ...
customer_reviews.text: These are good smokers, a good way to get into smoking without spending a fortune on it. I had the smaller model before and upgraded to the 18" because it was tricky to figure out how to arrange certain cuts of meat into the other one. As other people have commented, the hatch is the weak point of the design; you loose heat and smoke through there. But you can improve that a bit by bending it to fit a little more snugly. And once you get a grease/smoke "seasoning" on the inside of the kettle, the hatch seems to seal a bit better too.
customer_reviews.author: Aerel

customer_reviews.title: Great smoker for under $400
customer_reviews.text: I love my Weber Smokey mountain smoker I’ve been shopping for a smoker for quite a while and this is exactly what I was looking for charcoal smoker that can handle plenty of meat at once and the charcoal smoke along with chunks of hard wood add a great flavor to anything you smoke. Have used it to smoke a pork loin and Cedar planked Salmon and plan to used it many times to come.
customer_reviews.author: James Sells

customer_reviews.title: The 14" is the perfect size for 2-4 people.
customer_reviews.text: The 14" is the perfect size for 2-4 people. Glad we bought the 14" size. It works perfectly for 2 people and would easily handle 4. Some folks complain about the aluminum access door. Ours works great and will last a long time if you do not abuse it. Also installing the door with the handle on top seals better.
customer_reviews.author: S. Wilkins

customer_reviews.title: Must buy if you love bbq
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my husband as a Christmas gift. He has used it multiple times for perfect brisket and ribs. Don't worry if you find that it runs too hot during the first couple uses. After using it about three times, there was enough smoke and other residue built up to help maintain the perfect 225-240 degrees every time after that.
customer_reviews.author: Karina

customer_reviews.title: Perfect product for a first timer!
customer_reviews.text: This was my first ever attempt at using a smoker, so of course I was a little nervous about getting it right. The Weber Smokey Mt was easy to put together, and just as easy to use. By following the instructions, it worked flawlessly. It held at temperature and the food came out perfect. I would definitely recommend this smoker.
customer_reviews.author: Trat73

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Smoker
customer_reviews.text: Solid construction and works well. However, it is very time-consuming and difficult to clean. Temperature control is less than perfect because of the air coming through the door. The door leaks enough air to make it difficult to manage airflow and temperature.
customer_reviews.author: Dave in the Desert

customer_reviews.title: Great Smoker!!
customer_reviews.text: After reading many reviews on different smokers online, I decided to go with the WSM 22 after it was recommended multiple times. My husband is new to smoking and has been loving his new WSM 22. It was easy to assemble and has been great to smoke meat on. He followed a few youtube videos to help him get started, and now he's on a roll. He's cooked a pork butt, beer can chicken, and a smoked meatloaf in just the past week. All were delicious!!
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: Great smoker for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic product; worth every penny...made in the USA. Easy to put together and simple to cook on. Holds steady temps over many hours. It would be perfect if they put an ash release system at the bottom, which is why I gave it four stars for easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: wine country

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase I've made in a long time
customer_reviews.text: Best purchase I've made in a long time, I am still in love with it a year later. You can do it is simple and easy or as complicated as you like. It is very forgiving if you are a beginner but you can also turn out some professional quality food after you've played around for a little while. Start with easier and forgiving meats like chicken and pork loin, I don't recommend jumping into a 14 hr Brisket smoke right off the bat.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Love this Smoker!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this smoker! Seasoned it after it arrived and I was smoking ribs the following day. It really works and for the money, I think it would really be hard to beat. We've done a couple of briskets and they were amazing!! The smoke flavor was excellent and the Weber quality was as expected. The thermometer is at the top of the lid and may not be accurate at the place where the meat is cooking so I invested in a DOT digital thermometer and it really helps! I would buy this again in a hearbeat!
customer_reviews.author: Chicago Guy

customer_reviews.title: He loves it!
customer_reviews.text: Box was delivered to me upside down but nothing was damaged so it must be packaged well.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Kennedy

customer_reviews.title: This smoker is excellent. When I received it
customer_reviews.text: This smoker is excellent. When I received it, I seasoned it using Soo's method. We've cooked in it 5-6 times in the last month and have been very happy with it. The temperatures have been easy to control/maintain. I'm looking forward to using this for quite some time.
customer_reviews.author: Fletch

customer_reviews.title: This is a great smoker and using the bottom rack doubles as a ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great smoker and using the bottom rack doubles as a grill. Let's be honest, I'm no grill master and have no idea what I'm doing while smoking meat. That said, I smoked a turkey for thanksgiving which was outstanding. Googling instructions for how to smoke meat + making sure you put in lots of coals means even the worst bbq guy can successfully cook meat. This smoker includes this weird aluminum plate to catch ash which melts/catches on fire/somehow gets a big hole in it. I mean, it still functions as a smoker/grill, but my ash is now falling directly on the bottom part of the smoker which probably isn't good for it.
customer_reviews.author: Mdter

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for your buck smoker
customer_reviews.text: Best bang for your buck smoker. WSM is a great smoker for first timers. Keeps temperature relatively consistent. I have been able to fit 6 racks of ribs at a time. My only minor complaint is the door isn't stainless steel and it leaks smoke sometimes.
customer_reviews.author: P.T.

customer_reviews.title: My husband LOVES it!
customer_reviews.text: I gifted my husband this for our anniversary, he is in smoking in heaven! He absolutely loves it and I love it too b/c he is so excited to experiment with different meals, which means I get out of having to cook every night lol. He is very pleased and is already recommending it to his friends:)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Tiny Titan of BBQ
customer_reviews.text: This little bullet is awesome. I've smoked 6 racks on ribs in the past 2 weeks and they have been absolutely amazing. There's a reason these things are winning competitions. it is a bit on the smallish side obviously, but that fine as I'd like to be able to take it on the go for camping etc.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very Poor Quality Grates!!!
customer_reviews.text: Grates rust badly in only a few uses despite careful cleaning and oiling. Couldn't possibly be safe for ingestion! Meat sticks to rusty grates, tearing on removal from grate. Replacement grates did the same!!!
customer_reviews.author: V. Willeford

customer_reviews.title: Broke it in by "seasoning" twice with 4 pds of ...
customer_reviews.text: Broke it in by "seasoning" twice with 4 pds of fat, Salt pork and very cheap bacon. Then smoked a whole chicken. Very tasty and simple to use.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby D

customer_reviews.title: Best there is
customer_reviews.text: I've owned this smoker for around five years now. It is an awesome product, I have never had a bad result. There have been times when I was doing an overnight smoke and never woke up to check on the smoker. I would wake up in the morning in a panic, to go check on the smoker and found it still holding steady at 250 degrees, just like it was when I fell asleep. Just amazing how well this can hold a temp.
customer_reviews.author: G. Hansen

customer_reviews.title: Great other than the front door leaks bad
customer_reviews.text: I love it other than the front door leaks tons of smoke and I’m going to have to get a gasket kit . Get a second kettle 22" lower grate for the bottom. Still working on getting it seasoned, runs hot at first and have to have the air vents nearly closed.
customer_reviews.author: Mikael

customer_reviews.title: Buy it
customer_reviews.text: Looking for which size to buy? Depends on personality, if you drive a car and use coupons the smaller one would probably suit you. If your a country boy and drive a crew cab 4wd truck with big motor and could care less about gas and always prepared for anything get the 22. If anything, the 22 is a tad bit to small, hope they come out with a 30!
customer_reviews.author: Angelo

customer_reviews.title: Great smoker
customer_reviews.text: love the weber smokey mountain! I think the 18.5 is a perfect size for the amount of people that I normally cook for. Just FYI if your deciding between the 18.5 and the 22.5, the 18.5 cannot fit an entire packer brisket and a full slab of pork spareribs. I had to cut the spareribs in half to fit and didn't even try the brisket. Otherwise love the smoker.
customer_reviews.author: Shel

customer_reviews.title: My son loves his smoker
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my son. He uses it at least once a week. Everyone always looks forward to the weekend to see what he is going to make in his smoker.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Weber 22-inch Smokey Mountain Cooker, Charcoal Smoker
product_meta.description: Size:22-InchSlow down the pace and let barbecue fill the air. The Smokey Mountain Cooker smoker has two cooking grates to smoke two large items at once or plenty of ribs. The fuel door is removable so that adding charcoal and wood is easy, and the dampers allow you to be in control of the heat for tender, fall-off-the-bone meat.

Cooking Grid Dimensions 21 1/2 X 21 1/2". Main Grilling Area 363 Sq. Inches. Total Grilling Area 726 Sq. Inches

Weber Smokey Mountain Cooker reaches approximadetely 190°F inside temperature
